scene.name: intro
scene.line: I saw you folks drive up. I like your truck! What kind of truck is that?
scene.option: It doesn't belong to me, I just drive it.
We've got a couple of them at the shop, but this is the only one that runs.
Do you know where Dr. Truman is?

scene.name: just-drive
scene.line: Yeah, I knew you were a driver! What's the biggest haul you ever did?
scene.option: I moved a pool table once, in that same truck.
I moved a couple horses once, in a different truck.

scene.name: pool-table
scene.line: Me and Julian move whole houses, every night! That's a lot bigger than a pool table.

scene.name: horse
scene.line: Me and Julian move whole houses, every night! That's a lot bigger than a couple horses.

scene.name: only-one-that-runs
scene.line: Oh yeah, with a truck you've got to keep it up. That's why me and Julian don't use a truck. We just carry the houses!

scene.name: move-houses-responses
scene.option: Where do you take the houses?

scene.name: impressive
scene.line: Yeah, it's a big job.

scene.name: who-is-julian
scene.line: Julian's my brother. He's a lot bigger and stronger, and he has more feathers than me, but he's still my brother.
scene.option: Where do you take the houses?

scene.name: where-are-parents
scene.line: Well, I don't know where they are. Me and Julian were looking for them for a while, but ... Well, now we have a job to do: got to move these houses.
scene.option: Where do you take the houses?
Do you know where Dr. Truman is?

scene.name: where-houses
scene.line: Me and Julian take them out to the forest every night. And then we bring them back at dawn, before the museum opens.
scene.option: Why do you take them to the forest?
Is Dr. Truman in the forest?

scene.name: dr-truman
scene.line: Yes, ma'am. He's out in the forest. Me and Julian took him out there a few nights ago and he didn't want to come back. He lives there all the time now.

scene.name: forest
scene.line: This museum is an OK place to live in the daytime, but it's no good at night. Folks just can't sleep in a place like this; or when they do it gives them nightmares. So we take them out to the forest to sleep, and then bring them back in the morning.
scene.option: Is your family out in the forest?
And Dr. Truman is in the forest already?

scene.name: conway-tired
scene.line: He hurt his leg. We're looking for Dr. Truman to help him out. Is he out in the forest?
He hurt his leg. We're looking for Dr. Truman to help him out.

scene.name: dr-truman-forest
scene.line: Yes, ma'am. He's out in the forest. Me and Julian took him out there a few nights ago and he didn't want to come back. He lives there all the time now.
scene.option: Is your family out in the forest?
Can you tell us how to get there?

scene.name: ezra-family-forest
scene.line: Oh, no, they're ... I don't know where they are. Me and Julian were looking for them for a while, but ...

Anyway, we have a job to do here now, taking these people out to the forest at night so they can sleep. And maybe if the rest of them will be like Dr. Truman and want to stay out there, we'll get back to looking.
Can you tell us how to get to the forest?

scene.name: forest-directions
scene.line: You have to follow the Green river way out east, and then hop over Lake Cumberland! The roads don't go there.
But me and Julian can take you. We were just about to go anyway.
I've just got to call him over:
`(Yelling.)` KUK-*KUK*-KUK-*KUK* Hyyyyyyyyy-*aaaaaaa*!
